movies.title: INTO THE WILD
movies.summary: This story of a young man'S journey from city life to the wild,from the chaos of modern society to the purity of nature.Christopher is a top student ar a prestigious university ands a successful athlete.After his graduation he decides to he shouldn't live this life ,that feels wrong,lide a missing piece.So he left his all money an leaves everything behind and sets off on a journey to completely different and difficult ,life in this journey he meets a lot of people to change his perspective along the way...lets learn the rest together

movies.title: OLUMLU DUNYA
movies.summary: The Mermer Family, consisting of 8 people who have been running the Anadolu Tat Restaurant in Haydarpaşa Train Station for many years, seems like an ordinary business family when looked at from the outside. However, there is a big secret that this family is hiding. The family members are hired killers and they work for a worldwide organization. However, after some mistakes they make, they are exposed and exposed. From this point on, they will have no choice but to escape from the organization that is after them.

movies.title: THE GRAND BUDAPEST HOTEL
movies.summary: Directed by Wes Anderson.We can see his on style in this movie.Set in a fictional European country in the 1930's,it follows Monsieur Gustave, the chrismatic concierge of the famous Grand Budapest Hptel,and his loyal lobby boy Zero Mustafa.When Gustavo is falsely accused of murder,he embarks on a wild adventure filled with hilarious chases,ecentric characters and clever dialogue.

movies.title: HUSH
movies.summary: Maddie, a deaf woman, moves into a house in the woods to live alone. Maddie, who is trying to finish her busy book, is very happy with her new options. But one day, a message she receives while she is in front of the computer turns everything upside down. The message contains a photo of her current state. Maddie, who is watching and thinking about someone outside the house, encounters a large number of masked killers. Maddie had to fight hard to get rid of the masked man who tried to enter the house.

movies.title: THE BLIND SIDE
movies.summary: Synopsis. A young African American boy who doesn't know who his father is, whose mother is a drug addict, and who no one cares about among his 13 siblings, lives his life on the streets. This boy, who is illiterate and extremely unsuccessful in school, will change his life when he starts to be protected by a rich family.

movies.title: MANCHESTER BY THE SEA
movies.summary: Lee Chandler (Casey Affleck) is a divorced, quiet man who makes his living as a janitor in Quincy, Massachusetts. One day, when he receives news that his older brother Joe has had a heart attack, he returns to his hometown, the small seaside town of Manchester-by-the-Sea. However, when he arrives at the hospital, he learns that his brother has died. The real shock for Lee will be learning that he has been appointed as the guardian of his brother's 16-year-old son Patrick. He must move to this small town where he was born and raised to take care of the child, but the traumatic events Lee has experienced here will make him reluctant to move.

movies.title: THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION
movies.summary: The Shawshank Redemption tells the story of the world that two prisoners named Andy and Red create behind bars. Andy Dufresne is a young and successful banker. He is tried for the murder of his wife and her lover and is sentenced to life in prison. Beatings, torture, rape, all kinds of situations are experienced in Shawsank Prison, but Andy is still attached to life and optimistic. This attitude also affects those around him. With his hopeful perspective, Andy convinces all the prisoners around him that there is a free life even behind bars. Andy will also have a friend who will share in these efforts: Red. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins star in the film, which is a Stephen King adaptation. The film was nominated for an Oscar in 7 categories in 1995, including Best Picture.

books.title: THE ALCHEMIST
books.summary: This text is a magical fable about learning to listen to your heart, read the omens strewn along life's path and, above all, following your dreams. The book tells the story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who dreams of travelling the world in search of a fabulous worldly treasure.
books.author: Paulo Coelho

books.title: AROUND THE WORLD In 80 DAYS
books.summary: Certainly an Englishman, it was more doubtful whether Phileas Fogg was a Londoner. He was never seen on 'Change, nor at the Bank, nor in the counting-rooms of the City; no ships ever came into London docks of which he was the owner; he had no public employment; he had never been entered at any of the Inns of Court, either at the Temple, or Lincoln's Inn, or Gray's Inn; nor had his voice ever resounded in the Court of Chancery, or in the Exchequer, or the Queen's Bench, or the Ecclesiastical Courts. He certainly was not a manufacturer; nor was he a merchant or a gentleman farmer. His name was strange to the scientific and learned societies, and he never was known to take part in the sage deliberations of the Royal Institution or the London Institution, the Artisan's Association, or the Institution of Arts and Sciences…
books.author: Jule Verne

books.title: HARRY POTTER SERIES
books.summary: The *Harry Potter* series follows a young wizard, Harry Potter, who discovers he is famous for surviving an attack by the dark wizard Lord Voldemort. The story chronicles his time at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he forms close friendships and learns about magic. Ultimately, Harry battles Voldemort, exploring themes of good versus evil, friendship, love, and courage..
books.author: JK ROWLING

books.title: TREASURE ISLAND
books.summary: One of the best-loved adventure stories ever written, Treas­ure Island's timeless tale of pirates, lost treasure maps, mutiny and derring-do has appealed to generations of readers ever since Robert Louis Stevenson penned it in 1881 with the claim: If this don’t fetch the kids, why, they have gone rotten since my day.But more than just a children’s classic, the novel is considered to be one of the greatest feats of storytelling in the English language, with characters such as the unforgettable Long John Silver becoming part of the cultural consciousness. Treasure Island is a coming-of-age story that will captivate both adults and children for as long as stories are told.
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

books.title: ISTANBUL HATIRASI
books.summary: Istanbul Hatırası by Ahmet Ümit is a Turkish mystery-adventure novel. The story follows a murder investigation that takes place in Istanbul, with the city itself playing a central role. The plot weaves through both the historical and modern aspects of the city, taking readers on a journey across its streets, landmarks, and neighborhoods. The novel combines elements of suspense, intrigue, and the rich culture of Istanbul, offering a compelling and thrilling narrative for fans of crime and adventure stories. Ahmet Ümit masterfully explores the contrasts between the old and new worlds while keeping the reader hooked with a gripping mystery..
books.author: Ahmet Umit

books.title: BIR DUGUN GECESI
books.summary: This book, one of the important works of Turkish literature, tells the events of a wedding night from a humorous and satirical perspective.
books.author: Adalet Agaoglu

books.title: A MIDSUMMER NIGHT'S DREAM
books.summary: This book, one of the important works of Turkish literature, tells the events of a wedding night from a humorous and satirical perspective..
books.author: William Shakespeare

books.title: HABABAM SINIFI
books.summary: The free boarding students of this class, who were accused by their teachers of being lazy, naughty, and cheating, could not adapt to the authoritarian education system and expressed themselves in different ways. What they wanted was nothing but love and understanding. We all have common memories in the Hababam Class, which is the symbol of the struggle against this system that never changes.This class is the class of all of us…
books.author: Rıfat Ilgaz

books.title: THE MISER
books.summary: This famous play by French playwright Molière, translated into Turkish, tells the comedic story of a man who is overly obsessed with money and stinginess. The play has been performed frequently since the 19th century and remains a humorous work.
books.author: Molière

books.title: THE HITCHHIKER'S GUIDE TO THE GALAXY
books.summary: Seconds before the Earth is demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher for the revised edition of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy who, for the last fifteen years, has been posing as an out-of-work actor.Together this dynamic pair begin a journey through space aided by quotes from The Hitchhiker's Guide (A towel is about the most massively useful thing an interstellar hitchhiker can have) and a galaxy-full of fellow travelers: Zaphod Beeblebrox--the two-headed, three-armed ex-hippie and totally out-to-lunch president of the galaxy; Trillian, Zaphod's girlfriend (formally Tricia McMillan), whom Arthur tried to pick up at a cocktail party once upon a time zone; Marvin, a paranoid, brilliant, and chronically depressed robot; Veet Voojagig, a former graduate student who is obsessed with the disappearance of all the ballpoint pens he bought over the years.
books.author: Douglas Adams

books.title: DRACULA
books.summary: A gothic horror novel about Count Dracula's journey from Transylvania to London, where he seeks to spread the undead curse.
books.author: Bram Stoker

books.title: The SHINING
books.summary: Jack Torrance, a winter caretaker of an isolated hotel, slowly descends into madness under the influence of supernatural forces, threatening his family.
books.author: Stephen King

books.title: FRANKENSTEIN
books.summary: Victor Frankenstein creates a creature from dead body parts, only to regret it as the monster seeks revenge and causes destruction.
books.author: Mary Shelley

books.title: The Haunting of Hill House
books.summary: A woman is invited to stay at Hill House, where strange occurrences and a haunted past gradually reveal themselves in terrifying ways.
books.author: Shirley Jackson

books.title: The Call of Cthulhu
books.summary: An ancient alien god, Cthulhu, awakens, and the narrator uncovers the terrifying truth about the hidden cults that worship it.
books.author: H.P. Lovecraft

books.title: ZEHRA
books.summary: Zehra is a young girl raised in a small town. Abandoned by her father and neglected by her mother, she grows up with a deep sense of loneliness and a constant battle against the harsh environment around her. Despite all the odds, Zehra's resilience and search for belonging lead her to a new life where she finds friendship, love, and a purpose.
author: Elif Shafak

books.title: ANTONIUS AND KLEOPATRA
books.summary: The story of the passionate and tragic love affair between the Roman general Mark Antony and the Egyptian queen Cleopatra. Their political alliance and personal love become the center of a dramatic power struggle that leads to betrayal, war, and ultimately their downfall. Their love is tested by ambition, loyalty, and fate, shaping the course of history.
author: William Shakespeare

books.title: PRIDE AND PREJUDICE
books.summary: The novel follows the life of Elizabeth Bennet, one of five sisters, as she navigates love, relationships, and societal expectations in early 19th-century England. Her developing relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy challenges both of their preconceived notions about love, class, and pride, leading to a deeper understanding and mutual respect.
author: Jane Austen

books.title: LETTER FROM AN UNKOWN WOMAN
books.summary: The story revolves around a passionate, one-sided love affair. A woman writes a letter to a man she has loved for years, though he has no memory of her. Through her heartfelt letter, she recounts their brief encounter and the love that she carried in silence, ultimately revealing her emotional journey and the depth of her unspoken feelings.
author: Stefan Zweig

books.title: WUTHERING HEUGHTS
books.summary: The novel tells the tragic tale of Heathcliff and Catherine, whose intense, destructive love spans generations. Set on the Yorkshire moors, their passionate relationship affects everyone around them, leading to vengeance, obsession, and an eventual curse that haunts their families. The story explores themes of love, revenge, and the dark side of human nature.
author: Emily Brontë

books.title: LES MISÉRABLES
books.summary: Set against the backdrop of post-revolutionary France, this epic novel follows the lives of several characters, particularly Jean Valjean, an ex-convict, and his struggle for redemption. The story explores themes of love, sacrifice, and injustice, culminating in an emotionally devastating conclusion.
author: Victor Hugo

books.title: CATHERINE DE' MEDICI
books.summary: A historical novel depicting the life of Catherine de' Medici, the Italian noblewoman who became the Queen of France. The book explores her deep love for her children, her political struggles, and the tragic outcomes of her ambitions.
author: C. W. Gortner

books.title: SENSE AND SENSIBILITY
books.summary: The Dashwood sisters, Elinor and Marianne, experience the ups and downs of love and heartbreak in 19th-century England. Elinor's rationality contrasts with Marianne's emotional spontaneity, leading to differing views on love and loss, ultimately showcasing the emotional complexities of life.
author: Jane Austen

books.title: THE GREEN MILE
books.summary: This novel follows the lives of death row prison guards, particularly Paul Edgecombe, who befriends a miraculous inmate named John Coffey. Coffey has a mysterious healing gift, but the tragic and unjust turn of events leads to a heartbreaking conclusion that will have you sobbing.
author: Stephen King

books.title: THE BOOK THIEF
books.summary: Set during World War II in Nazi Germany, this novel follows Liesel Meminger, a young girl who finds solace in stealing books. As she navigates the horrors of war, Liesel’s journey is filled with love, loss, and the transformative power of words. Her bond with the people around her, especially with Max, a Jewish man hiding in her basement, will tear your heart apart.
author: Markus Zusak
